transcripts.text: This is Desi Lydic, a comedian and correspondent for The Daily Show.  Recently, she did a segment about the pink tax, a thing that absolutely exists in the real world.

Back in July 2016, Congresswoman Speier held a pink tax press conference and featured these two packages of CVS brand adult underwear, showing that the women's cost $2 more than the men's, and that the men's package contained four more items than the women's.  Cut to 2019, and the same exact packs of undergarments shown in the press conference are now magically the same price.  But here's the fun part.  CVS hasn't sold those diapers in over two years.
